message.content:
We will calculate each metric step‐by‐step using the “End_amount” data from the three statements.

1. Current Ratio  
   Current Assets = 9,122,854.19  
   Current Liabilities = 3,389,719.66  
   Current Ratio = 9,122,854.19 / 3,389,719.66 ≈ 2.69

2. Gross Profit Margin  
   Gross Profit = 287,062.51  
   Total Revenue = 791,992.51  
   Gross Profit Margin = (287,062.51 / 791,992.51) × 100 ≈ 36.24%

3. Debt to Asset Ratio  
   In the balance sheet, Total Liabilities can be derived as Total Assets – Total Owner’s Equity:  
     Total Assets = 19,501,451.49  
     Total Owner’s Equity = 16,111,731.83  
     Total Liabilities = 19,501,451.49 – 16,111,731.83 = 3,389,719.66  
   Debt to Asset Ratio = 3,389,719.66 / 19,501,451.49 ≈ 0.1738 or 17.38%

4. Net Profit Margin  
   Net Profit = 111,731.83  
   Total Revenue = 791,992.51  
   Net Profit Margin = (111,731.83 / 791,992.51) × 100 ≈ 14.11%

5. Cash to Current Debt Ratio  
   Cash and Cash Equivalents (end balance) are the sum of Cash on Hand and Bank Deposits:  
     Cash on Hand = 927,447.32  
     Bank Deposits = 71,662.08  
     Sum = 999,109.40  
   Cash to Current Debt Ratio = 999,109.40 / 3,389,719.66 ≈ 0.2947 or 29.47%

6. Free Cash Flow (FCF)  
   FCF is typically defined as Cash Flow from Operating Activities minus Capital Expenditures.  
     Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –4,504,752.68  
     Purchase of Fixed Assets (CapEx) = 2,496,137.92  
   FCF = –4,504,752.68 – 2,496,137.92 ≈ –7,000,890.60

7. Return on Assets (ROA)  
   ROA = Net Profit / Total Assets  
   = 111,731.83 / 19,501,451.49 ≈ 0.00573, or 0.57%

Below is the final answer in the required JSON format:

{
  "solution": {
    "Current Ratio": "2.69",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "36.24%",
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "17.38%",
    "Net Profit Margin": "14.11%",
    "Cash to Current Debt Ratio": "29.47%",
    "Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-7000890.60",
    "Return on Assets (ROA)": "0.57%"
  }
}
